intro: Selenicereus vagans, commonly known as the night blooming cereus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spineless stems and large, showy flowers that open at night. The plant produces white, fragrant blooms that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its stems are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Selenicereus vagans is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a popular choice for night-blooming gardens.
